name: Tofu Pizza
description: Delicious Japanese Tofu Pizza uses crispy pan-fried tofu slices as a replacement for pizza dough. Add your favorite toppings and mozzarella cheese, then set it under the broiler until melted and bubbly. This easy meal was among my favorite tofu dishes growing up!

video.name: How To Make Tofu Pizza (Recipe) 豆腐のピザの作り方 （レシピ）
video.description:
Delicious melted mozzarella cheese, mushroom, ham, and basil leaves on slices of crispy pan fried tofu.

For the complete recipe, please visit: http://www.justonecookbook.com/recipes/tofu-pizza/

Ingredients:

1 block of firm tofu
3 slices ham
2 mushrooms
1 tomato
¼ cup potato/corn starch or flour
½ tsp. Salt
Freshly ground black pepper
2-3 Tbsp. ketchup
2-4 basil leaves
1 cup mozzarella cheese
Parsley for garnish (optional)

Music courtesy of Audio Network: "Day in the Sun"
-------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Check out my blog: http://www.justonecookbook.com/

-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
❀ Follow Just One Cookbook ❀

recipeIngredient: ¼ cup potato starch or cornstarch ((or substitute flour))
½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt

recipeInstructions.text: Slice 1 block firm tofu in half to make 2 thin, flat slabs. Wrap with a paper towel. Place a plate and a heavy object on top of the tofu and set aside for 15 minutes. This process will help the tofu drain faster.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice 1 block firm tofu in half to make 2 thin, flat slabs. Wrap with a paper towel. Place a plate and a heavy object on top of the tofu and set aside for 15 minutes. This process will help the tofu drain faster.

recipeInstructions.text: Slice 3 slices ham into thin strips.
recipeInstructions.name: Slice 3 slices ham into thin strips.

recipeInstructions.text: Season ¼ cup potato starch or cornstarch or flour with ½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper and mix well. Coat all sides of the tofu with the potato starch or flour. This step helps the tofu retain moisture.
recipeInstructions.name: Season ¼ cup potato starch or cornstarch or flour with ½ tsp Diamond Crystal kosher salt and freshly ground black pepper and mix well. Coat all sides of the tofu with the potato starch or flour. This step helps the tofu retain moisture.

recipeInstructions.text: Heat some neutral oil over medium-high heat in an oven-safe skillet (or regular nonstick frying pan). Cook the tofu until the bottom is crispy and golden brown. Flip and brown the other side. If your frying pan is not oven safe, transfer the tofu to a baking dish lined with parchment paper later on.
recipeInstructions.name: Heat some neutral oil over medium-high heat in an oven-safe skillet (or regular nonstick frying pan). Cook the tofu until the bottom is crispy and golden brown. Flip and brown the other side. If your frying pan is not oven safe, transfer the tofu to a baking dish lined with parchment paper later on.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide 2–3 Tbsp ketchup on top of the cooked tofu. Then, top with slices of tomato and 2–4 leaves basil.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide 2–3 Tbsp ketchup on top of the cooked tofu. Then, top with slices of tomato and 2–4 leaves basil.

recipeInstructions.text: Put the sliced ham and sliced mushrooms on top.
recipeInstructions.name: Put the sliced ham and sliced mushrooms on top.

recipeInstructions.text: Divide and sprinkle with 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Then, place the pan in the oven and broil for 5–7 minutes, until the cheese has melted. Top with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.
recipeInstructions.name: Divide and sprinkle with 1 cup mozzarella cheese. Then, place the pan in the oven and broil for 5–7 minutes, until the cheese has melted. Top with chopped parsley. Serve immediately.

itemListElement.text: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.
itemListElement.name: You can keep the leftovers in an airtight container and store in the refrigerator for up to 3 days.

review.reviewBody: Ooo I have pizza stone! Will try it with preparing my tofu pizza :-)
Sounds interesting! Will try some day.
